I hope this is not too dumb of a question but I downloaded the file and the audio comes through great but I cannot get the video to play on any of my media players.  Can you please point me in the right direction of how to play the file?  Thanks.

You must have divx codec. I play the file in windows mediaplayer10 (PC) and philips lx3900sa home theater. It yust a AVI (DIVX) file.
They play with no problem.
Google "VLC" it'll come up as VideoLan, if it can't play it nothing can.

How can I split the file into two for regular CD burning?  I don't have a DVD burner.
Any info would be appreciated.

MacLaddy - If U don't have already, D/L K-Lite codec bundle & VirtualDubMod.  Set VDM for 'Video': 'direct stream copy', split & save into separate files.  ISO Hunt & MiniNova forums have all this info....

what program do I need to open these torrent files, i am new to this. My computer does not recognize the program that created the file and is asking for me to connect to the web, please help

For:irelaj2
"what program do I need to open these torrent files, i am new to this. My computer does not recognize the program that created the file and is asking for me to connect to the web, please help."

Open "Google", type "Torrent", and read every think about torrent.
Then type "BitTornado", download it and install.
Then double click downloaded file with extension *.torrent (downloaded from this site)
Then with your mouse tell the program where to download.......

I did not get any sound when I opened the file with QuickTime (I was using a Mac). I was very disappointed. I then downloaded VLC Player, and THE SOUND WORKED! I was very happy! Thank you for the movie, it works PERFECTLY!!! ;)
